metadata.title: CVE-2019-8956 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux Kernel before versions 4.20.8 and 4.19.21 a use-after-freeerror in the "sctp_sendmsg()" function (net/sctp/socket.c) when handlingSCTP_SENDALL flag can be exploited to corrupt memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8956` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-17-generic - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-17-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-17-lowlatency - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-17-snapdragon - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-17-generic - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-17-lowlatency - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-1014-azure - 4.18.0-1014.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.5').
linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-1014.14~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-oem package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.3').
linux-oracle package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9').
